graph_title: The proportion of women using Sexual and Reproductive Health Services for contraception, by main method of contraception
indicator_available: The proportion of women using Sexual and Reproductive Health Services for contraception, by main method of contraception
indicator_name: Proportion of women of reproductive age (aged 15–49 years) who have their need for family planning satisfied with modern methods
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 3: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 3.7: By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 3.7.1: Proportion of women of reproductive age (aged 15–49 years) who have their need for family planning satisfied with modern methods
STAT_CONC_DEF__GLOBAL: Sexual Reproductive Health (SRH) services include family planning services, community contraception clinics, integrated GUM and SRH services and young people’s services e.g. Brook advisory centres. IUD refers to intrauterine device. IU System refers to intrauterine system.
REC_USE_LIM__GLOBAL:
Data is not representative of the uptake of contraception methods across the whole population. Contraceptives can be obtained from other sources such as GPs or direct from pharmacies, whilst non-prescription items like condoms can be obtained easily without a visit to a medical specialist.

For analysis of contraception methods it is encouraged that data be presented as proportions rather than numbers. This is because the level of SRH service provision is constantly changing.
SDG_GOAL: Goal 3: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
SDG_TARGET: Target 3.7: By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 3.7.1: Proportion of women of reproductive age (aged 15–49 years) who have their need for family planning satisfied with modern methods
STAT_CONC_DEF: Sexual Reproductive Health (SRH) services include family planning services, community contraception clinics, integrated GUM and SRH services and young people’s services such as Brook advisory centres. IUD refers to intrauterine device. IU System refers to intrauterine system.
REC_USE_LIM: Data is not representative of the uptake of contraception methods across the whole population. Contraceptives can be obtained from other sources such as GPs or direct from pharmacies, whilst non-prescription items like condoms can be obtained easily without a visit to a medical specialist. Excludes women where no main method of contraception was recorded during the year.
